snippet: William J. Palatucci, one of Gov. Chris Christie’s advisers, said he was resigning from Community Education Centers, which dominates a system deemed dangerous and poorly supervised.
abstract: William J Palatucci is resigning from Community Education Centers, company dominating troubled system of halfway houses in New Jersey; resignation follows  widespread criticism that CEC facilities are oversized, dangerous and poorly supervised; political analysts say departure signals Gov Christie's desire to avoid a potential liability as 2013 elections loom--he has been closely linked to the company.
lead_paragraph: William J. Palatucci, one of Gov. Chris Christie’s advisers, said he was resigning from Community Education Centers, which dominates a system deemed dangerous and poorly supervised.

headline.seo: Executive Tied to New Jersey’s Halfway Houses, William J. Palatucci, Is Stepping Down
headline.main: Executive at Company Tied to New Jersey’s Halfway Houses Is Leaving
headline.print_headline: Executive at Company Tied to New Jersey’s Halfway Houses Is Leaving
